personality.title: Vastro
personality.look: You meet a massive, alarmingly muscled man, wearing polished armor. He appraises you carefully as you approach.
personality.name: "I am Vastro, head trainer for Warrior's Grove."
personality.job: "I am the trainer for the Grove. I teach people skills so they can survive in the surrounding lands."

personality.title: Rippel
personality.look: A lovely woman with delicate features sits behind the counter. She is gluing bright blue feathers on the shafts of iron-tipped arrows.
personality.name: "I am known as Rippel the fletcher. Welcome to my shop."
personality.job: "I perform the same job I have performed in many strange lands. I create missile weapons of the finest quality. You may purchase them if you like."
personality.unknown: "I know not of which you speak."

personality.title: Walner
personality.look: A heavy set man sits behind the counter, wearing the traditional blue robes of an apprentice mage. The robes show a bit of wear and tear, as if he's been travelling for some time.
personality.name: He nods in greeting. "I am called Walner."
personality.job: "I am, I'm quite proud to say, a sage with no small experience. Whether in the fields of alchemy or identification, I can be of great assistance to you."

personality.title: Marian
personality.look: You interrupt a priestess. She concludes her chanting, turns, and bows to you. The ankh around her neck indicates some proficiency in the healing arts.
personality.name: "I am Marian. Welcome to the Shrine of Divine Health."
personality.job: "The Shrine of Divine Health is dedicated to all of the healing arts. It certainly comes in handy here in Warrior's Grove."

personality.title: Gonski
personality.look: You meet the shop proprietor, a scarred, withered old man. His leathery skin shows the signs of many years under the sun, and his arms have the thin pale lines left by many old wounds.
personality.name: "I'm Gonski," he grunts.
personality.job: He pats a nearby greatsword. "We got armor. We got weapons. We got shields. You can sell me your old stuff too."

personality.title: Ella
personality.look: You walk up to the innkeeper. She doesn't seem surprised in the least to see big, beefy adventurers in her bar.
personality.name: She smiles. "I'm Ella, owner of the Warrior's Arms. How may I help you?"
personality.job: "We have all the things adventurers need. We can give you a room to rest in for the night, for only 5 gold. We have cheap rations available. And, of course, a tankard of beer is only a gold piece."
personality.unknown: She smiles and shakes her head. "You'll have to make more sense than that."

node.text: "That's where you are now."
"I know not what you will find in the lands surrounding Warrior's Grove. You may rest assured, however, that they are filled with adventure, treasure, and direst peril."
"Perhaps you would like some training to help you survive?"
She sighs. "Before I came to Warrior's Grove, I practiced my trade in many cities, both on the surface and in Exile."
"I can hardly remember all the cities I have worked in. All I know is that there wll surely be many more."
Rippel's Fletching
"Adventures. Wars. Hordes of rampaging demons. I've seen it all."
He looks over your items with a practiced eye. It only takes a moment to figure out what each one is. With a smile, he says "No problem. Each identification will be a mere 10 gold."
Walner's potions
"Are you interested in identification or potions?"
He coughs modestly. "Why, my identification skills alone make me invaluable to adventurers."
Marian the Healer
"We priests and priestesses of healing dedicate ourselves to the restoration of those who fall ill, break bones, are gnawed on by monsters, that sort of thing."
"I don't know what's going on outside these walls. However, considering the number of mutilated people that have been coming back lately, it must be something unpleasant."
"We got all sorts of weapons here. You'll need to be well equipped when you leave town."
"There's plenty of monsters out there." He snorts. "Probably too much for the likes of you. But if you want to have a chance, you want some of my weapons."
Fine Weapons
Fine Armor
Fine Shields
"Weapons, armor, or shields?"
He looks over your surplus goods. "A pretty sorry lot. Still, I might be able to offer you a little for it." He makes an offer for all of your identified items.
"A room, rations, or beer?"
She shows you to your room, and wishes you a pleasant night.
She shakes her head. "Sorry, but that's 5 gold."
Fine Rations
She serves up the beer. It's refreshing, in a nasty sort of way.
She looks pityingly upon you. "Not a gold piece to your name. How sad."
"Yes. Oh, and please bandage your wounds before going to your room. It's a great pain to clean the blood out of the blankets."
